description: Back-formation from laser, as if removing -er. Compare mase.

verbs.description: lase (third-person singular simple present lases, present participle lasing, simple past and past participle lased)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To use a laser beam on, as for cutting.
examples: The surgeon lased the elongated soft palate, cutting off the excess tissue and stopping the blood flow in one swipe.
The physical chemist lased the atoms as they passed between the electrodes to study their motion.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To use a laser beam on, as for targeting or rangefinding.
examples: The commander lased the target across the valley.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To operate as a laser; to release coherent light due to stimulation.
examples: Once enough of the gas particles are in a higher energy state, they will begin to lase and give off a coherent beam.
